instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turning on
threads.message:
Hi,
We got a mentioned MacBook with was liquid damaged.
Liquid damage was around <TRANSISTOR>Q8175</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U5870</CHIP>
I cleaned up board and fixed broken traces around <TRANSISTOR>Q8175</TRANSISTOR>
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> present 1.02V
Rail 3,34V present
PPbus_S5_hscomputing present 11.8V
<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PHASE1</SIGNAL> = 1.86v
<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PHASE2</SIGNAL> = 1.86v
L7630 voltage present 1,05V
once I connect mouse to usb it blinks and thats it
no chime no display
cpu gets warm.
FAN spin for me ones.
Any ideas?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turning on
threads.message:
Fan doesn't spin untill CPU gets really hot on this model.
Mouse just flash once, no steady light?

I cannot locate <TRANSISTOR>Q8175</TRANSISTOR> on schematic...

Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turning on
MacBook Pro 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage not turning on
threads.message: Laptop fixed, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> was faulty. Thanks for any help.
